div.p: The mail this morning brought me thru letters from your dates 17, 21 & 24th Jany one of them concerning a bill of exchange of $492.01 which I have forwarded to Alexr Henry June 26 - I have previously paid Ms Henry $450 which is all that I will give them I am very sorry to find the Tobacco doing so badly I had anticipated a bad account but cant not have thought it so bad as it is I wish it was sold at all events and done with - springs claims for lost property have been returned to me by him and now found but the amount has been reduced much below the normal amount first the wages of the horse after his death than the clothing & last the ???? reduced has all been

deducted leaving the amt recieved on his two claims only $90.58. that sum I want send to you for him butt the session being so near a close I will defer it untils I go myself - Mrs Mallords claim was returned by me to Mr Stone with written Blank forms to be filed up by the wedow it has been attended to and Returned to me complete and now ready reportedfor payment, I shals claim the best part of the ??? on this as it has given me much trouble that I expected you had obviated by attending to the Law and the rules loses claim has been paid & Geffords claim for paid ???horse claim will be paid to me but
